raw_text:
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
ALEXANDER CITY DIVISION
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR,)
Plaintiff, )
)
v. ) CASE NO.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
)
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND, )
Defendant. )
PLAINTIFF’S RESPONSES TO DEFENDANTS’ DISCOVERY
COMES NOW Christopher Blaine McGregor, the Plaintiff in the above-styled cause, by
and through his attorney of record, Tom F. Young, Jr., and responds to the Interrogatories and
request for Production as follows:
INTERROGATORIES
1. Describe in detail each instance since February 27, 2024, in which you did not allow the
Petitioner-Mother, Brittany Michelle Gilliland, her scheduled visitation rights with the
minor children A.K. and B.M.
Response: I have never refused Brittany her scheduled visitation rights with either
minor child.
2. List all communications you have had with the children's school or educational institution
concerning Brittany Gilliland and provide the content of such communications.
Response: See attached email exchanges from Blaine to staff at L. Morgan and ME
Walker.
3. Please detail any reasons and the factual basis for why you prevented Brittany Gilliland
from picking up A.K. from school as stipulated in the Final Decree of Divorce.
Response: I have never prevented Brittany from picking up A.K. from school.
4. Please describe any instances where you have accused Brittany Gilliland of mental
instability or suggested to any individual, including the minor children, that she is
mentally unstable.
Response: I cannot recall.
5. State the name and address of all persons having substantive knowledge relating to this
matter and identify whether or not you intend to use those persons at any proceeding in
this matter as witnesses or as an expert witness, including to what you expect each
witness will testify and if as an expert witness, list the expert’s name, address, the subject
matter of the testimony on which the expert is expected to testify, the substance of facts
and opinions to which the expert is expected to testify, and a summary of the grounds for
each opinion offered.
Response: Will Davis – DARE/School Resource Office
Deidre Leslie – Tri-County Children Advocacy Center / A.K. Counselor
Payton East – DHR case worker
Adeline Kate McGregor – Daughter
Lisa McGregor – Mother
Brian McGregor – Brother
Katie McGregor – Sister-in-law
6. List in detail all documents and other physical evidence which you may use in
preparation or at any of the proceedings of this cause including any pictures of an explicit
nature or otherwise, regardless of whether you intend to use it at the trial in this action.
This includes anything related to rebuttal or impeachment.
Response: Pictures attached.
7. Please state all facts that support your accusations made against Brittany Gilliland of
causing physical harm to A.K. or any of the minor children.
Response: Objection. Irrelevant as to issues in Petition.
8. If you have conducted any surveillance, including but not limited to electronic
surveillance (electronic surveillance being defined as the interception of any voice
communication made by the Petitioner by electronically recording the same or by
listening in on any voice communication made by the Petitioner), of the Petitioner, or had
any person or persons conduct such surveillance on your behalf, then state what
surveillance you have conducted, including the date, time and place of such surveillance,
the method employed for such surveillance, the person conducting such surveillance,
including the name and address of such person, whether said surveillance was recorded,
whether a written transcript or report have been made of such surveillance, and the details
of what was observed and/or the details of the conversations that were intercepted or
recorded, regardless of whether you intend to use such documentation at trial. This
includes anything related to rebuttal or impeachment.
Response: I do not have surveillance.
9. Please state all facts that support your accusations made against Brittany Gilliland for
violating the divorce decree.
2
Response: Brittany has violated divorce decree by being late on CS payment.
Picking and choosing when she wants to pick up AK from school and not
following Court Order.
Refuses to reimburse 50% of all medical expenses for children.
Harassing me and the children by calling up to 150 times a month.
Brittany makes negative remarks regarding the divorce on Facebook.
Brittany harasses by family. One example is calling my sister-in-law,
Katie, a fat bitch. This was at the front entrance of Wal-Mart and Bennett
was in Brittany’s care. Katie pressed charges and awaiting on court date.
10. Please provide a detailed list of the personal property items you have failed to distribute
to Brittany Gilliland per the Final Decree of Divorce, including but not limited to wall
décor, bedroom lamps, memory boxes, and clothing.
Response: Brittany was given all property items set out in the Final Order, plus more.
Her friend, Jeannie Hamlet, came to the house and removed everything
that Brittany was entitled to have plus items that were not granted to her.
11. Please explain any instances in which you have signed Brittany Gilliland’s name on
financial documents or checks without her express authorization. Provide dates and
details of the documents.
Response: I have not signed her name to anything.
12. Please state what positive and negative qualities you feel the Petitioner has as a parent.
Response: I cannot think of anything positive at this time. Brittany’s negative
qualities are being unreliable, having no stability, and she is a constant liar.
13. Please state the last-known date that A.K., a Minor Child, engaged in visitation with
Mother, pursuant to the original Divorce Decree. Please provide explanations for specific
instances where Mother was denied visitation, if there are such instances.
Response: The last known date that AK had court ordered visitation with her mother
was on May 12, 2024, for Mother’s Day. I met Brittany at the ACPD to do
custody exchange and Lt. Sheronda Cross forced AK out of my care into
Brittany’s car. I have never refused to allow AK to visit with her mother.
14. Please state whether you have paid Mother her required equity payments owed on your
prior marital residence, the amount paid, and which dates, since the execution of your
original Divorce Decree.
3
Response: March 7, 2024 - $10,000
April 18, 2024 - $2,000
May 16, 2024 - $2,000
June 19, 2024 - $2,000
July 25, 2024 - $2,000
See attachments.
15. Please state any instances where the Department of Human Resources has gotten involved
in a case regarding Minor Children, what prompted the investigation, and the conclusion
of the DHR matter.
Response: December 23, 2023 – DHR called me to bring the kids into the
office for questions. Someone reported to DHR the events that were called
out during our divorce trial.
March 15, 2023 – DHR showed up to my house. AK started seeing a new
counselor, therefore counselor needed to self-report to DHR. I informed
Brittany via text that DHR was at the house and why.
April 1, 2024 – DHR called to inform me that they had received a call and
was going to the school to talk to AK. A teacher had noticed bruising on
AK’s arm that resembled fingers/hands. After speaking to AK, DHR
came to my house. While talking to AK, she described the incident between
her and her mother that occurred on Easter morning. AK said her mother
grabbed her and lift bruising on her arms. A police report was filed on
Easter regarding this incident.
16. Please list all social media accounts with names/handles/usernames (e.g. Facebook,
Instagram, snapchat).
Response: Facebook – Blaine McGregor; Instagram – Blaine0256; TikTok –
Blainemcgregor.
Are you aware that your answers to these interrogatories are made under oath, are
continuing in nature, and may be used as material testimony at any and all proceedings?
Response: Yes.
17. Please state each and every person who assisted you in answering these interrogatories
and whether you are aware that your answers to these interrogatories are given under
oath.
Response: No one.
4
REQUEST FOR PRODUCTION
1. Please provide documents or communications demonstrating the reasons for any
denial of visitation rights to Brittany Gilliland since February 27, 2024.
Response: None.
2. Please provide all correspondence, emails, texts, and written notes between you and the
children’s school or educational institutions regarding Brittany Gilliland.
Response: See attached
3. Please provide any recordings, videos, or other electronic evidence that demonstrates
interactions between you and the minor children wherein Brittany Gilliland was
discussed.
Response: None
4. All documents evidencing payments made for child support, alimony, shared debts,
and/or other financial obligations as ordered in the Final Decree of Divorce.
Response: See Attached
5. Produce copies of all photos, videos, CDs or other evidence you have in this case, even if
you do not plan on using it at trial or any other proceeding of this action. This includes any
rebuttal and/or impeachment evidence.
Response: Objection. Rebuttal/impeachment witnesses cannot be determined at this
time.
6. Please provide photographic or video evidence of the condition and location of the
disputed personal property items that were to be distributed to Brittany Gilliland as per
the divorce decree.
Response: I am unaware of any disputed property.
7. Please provide any and all bank statements, passbooks, certificates of deposit, or other
written memoranda of any kind and description reflecting ownership by you in whole or
in part, legal or equitable, of any savings account or bank account or account in any
financial institution, including, but not limited to, savings and loan associations, credit
unions, banks or accounts maintained with any brokerage firm from the last three years.
Response: Objection. Irrelevant as to issues in Petition.
5
8. Please provide any and all documentation to support your response to Interrogatory # 3,
including any and all documents touching, concerning, or relating to your net worth,
including, but not limited to, personal financial statement and loan applications filed with
or provided to any person, corporation, business, financial institution, or government
agency from January 1, 2019, to the date of trial.
Response: Objection. Financial records have no relevance to the issue in
Interrogatory #3.
Respectfully submitted this the 30th day of July 2024.
/s/ Tom F. Young, Jr.
TOM F. YOUNG, JR. (YOU009)
Attorney for Plaintiff
OF COUNSEL:
MORRIS HAYNES LAW FIRM
131 Main Street
P.O. Box 1660
Alexander City, AL 35010
(256) 329-2000
(256) 329-2015
tyoung@mhhlaw.net
Certificate of Service
I hereby certify that I have served a copy of the foregoing upon the following via electronic
filing with the AlaCourt E-File System and/or by placing a copy of the same, properly addressed
and postage paid in the U.S. Mail on this the 30th day of July 2024.
/s/ Tom F. Young, Jr.
Of Counsel
6
